hints.label: def-effective-counts-two-scales
hints.title: Effective Interaction Counts (Two Scales)
hints.content:
148: :label: def-effective-counts-two-scales
149: 
150: **1. Softmax Effective Companions** (scale $\varepsilon_c$):
151: 
152: $$
153: k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}(i) := \left|\left\{\ell \in \mathcal{A} : d_{\text{alg}}(i,\ell) \leq R_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}\right\}\right|
154: 
155: $$
156: 
157: where:
158: 
159: $$
160: R_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)} = \varepsilon_c \sqrt{C_{\text{comp}}^2 + 2\log(k^2)}
161: 
162: $$
163: 
164: **Scaling**:
165: 
166: $$
167: k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}(i) = O(\rho_{\max} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d} \cdot (\log k)^d)
168: 
169: $$
170: 
171: **Properties**:
172: - Grows logarithmically with $k$
173: - NOT k-uniform
174: - Controls softmax companion sums over $\ell$
175: 
176: **2. Localization Effective Neighbors** (scale $\rho$):
177: 
178: $$
179: k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}(i) := \left|\left\{j \in \mathcal{A} : d_{\text{alg}}(i,j) \leq R_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}\right\}\right|
180: 
181: $$
182: 
183: where:
184: 
185: $$
186: R_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = C_\rho \cdot \rho
187: 
188: $$
189: 
190: for some constant $C_\rho$ independent of $k$.
191: 
192: **Scaling**:
193: 
194: $$
195: k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}(i) = O(\rho_{\max} \cdot \rho^{2d})
196: 
197: $$
198: 
199: **Properties**:
200: - Independent of $k$
hints.raw_directive:
145: The Geometric Gas fitness potential involves **two distinct spatial scales** with separate effective interaction counts. It is crucial to distinguish these to understand which bounds are k-uniform.
146: 
147: :::{prf:definition} Effective Interaction Counts (Two Scales)
148: :label: def-effective-counts-two-scales
149: 
150: **1. Softmax Effective Companions** (scale $\varepsilon_c$):
151: 
152: $$
153: k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}(i) := \left|\left\{\ell \in \mathcal{A} : d_{\text{alg}}(i,\ell) \leq R_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}\right\}\right|
154: 
155: $$
156: 
157: where:
158: 
159: $$
160: R_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)} = \varepsilon_c \sqrt{C_{\text{comp}}^2 + 2\log(k^2)}
161: 
162: $$
163: 
164: **Scaling**:
165: 
166: $$
167: k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}(i) = O(\rho_{\max} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d} \cdot (\log k)^d)
168: 
169: $$
170: 
171: **Properties**:
172: - Grows logarithmically with $k$
173: - NOT k-uniform
174: - Controls softmax companion sums over $\ell$
175: 
176: **2. Localization Effective Neighbors** (scale $\rho$):
177: 
178: $$
179: k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}(i) := \left|\left\{j \in \mathcal{A} : d_{\text{alg}}(i,j) \leq R_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}\right\}\right|
180: 
181: $$
182: 
183: where:
184: 
185: $$
186: R_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)} = C_\rho \cdot \rho
187: 
188: $$
189: 
190: for some constant $C_\rho$ independent of $k$.
191: 
192: **Scaling**:
193: 
194: $$
195: k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}(i) = O(\rho_{\max} \cdot \rho^{2d})
196: 
197: $$
198: 
199: **Properties**:
200: - Independent of $k$
201: - **k-uniform** ✓

hints.label: notation-keff-superscripts
hints.title: k_eff Superscript Convention
hints.content:
206: :label: notation-keff-superscripts
207: 
208: When we write "$k_{\text{eff}}$" without superscript, the scale should be clear from context:
209: - If discussing softmax, companion selection, or measurements $d_j$: assume $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}$
210: - If discussing localization weights $w_{ij}$, localized moments $\mu_\rho, \sigma_\rho$: assume $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$
211: 
212: For clarity in proofs, **always use superscript notation** $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}$ or $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$.
hints.raw_directive:
203: :::
204: 
205: :::{prf:notation} k_eff Superscript Convention
206: :label: notation-keff-superscripts
207: 
208: When we write "$k_{\text{eff}}$" without superscript, the scale should be clear from context:
209: - If discussing softmax, companion selection, or measurements $d_j$: assume $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}$
210: - If discussing localization weights $w_{ij}$, localized moments $\mu_\rho, \sigma_\rho$: assume $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$
211: 
212: For clarity in proofs, **always use superscript notation** $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}$ or $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\rho)}$.
